pages.text:
4 
 
Executive Summary in District Domestic Product(DDP) 
 
DDP estimestes are very useful indicator of economic development & 
provide the fair idea of regional differences within the state. This release of DDP 
estimate is based on base year 2011-2012. This publication presents the DDP 
estimate from 2011-212 to 2017-2018PE . In terms io size of the economy, 
Haridwar is the largest economy for year 2017-2018PE  with a size of Rs. 6757353 
Lakh & district Rudraprayag is the smallest with a size of Rs. 271316 lakh. The PCI 
is highest fir Haridwar district i.e. Rs.293078 & lowest for Rudraprayag district i.e 
Rs. 88987 for year 2017-18PE . The district laving growth rate in year 2017-18PE is 
Udham singh nagar with the growth of 10.29 percent & least growing district  is 
Nainital with the growth rate of 5.54 present. 
Uadham Singh Nagar 
 
The size of the economy i.e DDP at current prices is estimated Rs. 2273148 
lakh in year 2011-12 & is provisionally estimated Rs. 4445715 lakh for the year 
2017-18PE In terms of percentage growth, the size of the economy from 14.07% in 
year 2012-13 to 17.29% in the year 2017-18PE  .  
 
In terms of Constant prices, the size of the economy i.e. DDP is estimated        
Rs. 2273148 lakh in year 2011-12 & provisionally estimated Rs. 3621508 lakh for 
the year 2017-18PE . In terms of percentage growth, DDP at constant price i.e. 
economy registered growth of 8.87% in year 2012-13 &  10.29% in the year 2017-
18PE   
 
Per capita income is estimated Rs. 119936 in year 2011-12 whereas it is 
provisionally estimated Rs. 220429 for the year 2017-18PE . In terms of percentage 
growth with respect to previous year comparison, per capita NDDP at current 
price or per capita income increases by 13.53% in year 2012-13 to 16.20% in the 
year 2017-18PE.
